final_answer.precision_note: Answer is given to 3 significant figures, consistent with the precision of the input data (moles and volume).

method: The equilibrium constant (Kc) is calculated using the expression $K_c = [\text{NO}_2]^2 / [\text{N}_2\text{O}_4]$. First, the concentrations for each species are determined using the volume ($V = 2.00 \text{ dm}^3$) and the formula $c = n/V$. [\text{NO}_2] = 0.180 \text{ mol} / 2.00 \text{ dm}^3 = 0.0900 \text{ mol dm}^{-3}$. [\text{N}_2\text{O}_4] = 0.220 \text{ mol} / 2.00 \text{ dm}^3 = 0.110 \text{ mol dm}^{-3}$. Finally, these concentrations are substituted into the $K_c$ expression: $K_c = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 \approx 0.0736$. The result is reported as dimensionless as specified (L21).
checks: Concentrations are correctly calculated using the vessel volume (2.00 dm3).
The concentration of NO2 is correctly squared in the Kc expression.
The final answer is reported as dimensionless, as required.
